title: Sri Lanka stock trading halted after 5-pct drop
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s stock trading was halted two minutes after opening as an index of liquid stocks dropped 5 percent, extending a rout seen over recent days.
“..the Market has been halted for 30 minutes due to the S&P SL20 index dropping over 5% from the previous close,” the Colombo Stock Exchange said.
Sri Lanka’s stock have been moving up with money printed to keep interest rates low.
Prices were partly driven by inflation expectations, with export firms in particular promoted with currency depreciation expected due to money printing.
Protestors were peaceful but there was a sudden violence. It is not clear who triggered the violence. (Colombo/Apr01/2022)
